intro: Brassica rapa var. sinensis, commonly known as Chinese kale or gai lan, is a leafy vegetable characterized by its dark green, thick, and tender stalks and leaves. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other cruciferous vegetables like broccoli and cabbage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small yellow flowers that eventually develop into round, green pods containing edible seeds. Its leaves and stalks are rich in nutrients such as vitamins A, C, and K, as well as dietary fiber. The plant is well adapted to temperate climates and is widely cultivated in Asia for its nutritional value and culinary versatility.
